page.title: 07SOME VILLAGE CUSTOMS,BANKS
page.content:
EACH JULY IN BANKS VILLAGE THE CHURCH HOLDS ITS WALKING DAY. THERE IS A PROCESSION THROUGH THE VILLAGE AND THE SUNDAY SCHOOL QUEEN WITH HER ATTENDANTS TAKES PART.THERE ARE VARIOUS FLOATS INCLUDING ONE FROM ST.STEPHEN'S C.E. PRIMARY SCHOOL.
ANOTHER VILLAGE CUSTOM IS FOR THE CHURCH PRIMARY SCHOOL TO HOLD A MAY QUEEN DAY EACH YEAR IN THE SCHOOL GROUNDS.THE QUEEN IS CHOSEN BY HER CLASSMATES TOGETHER WITH HER CONSORT AND ATTENDANTS.THE SCHOOL GIVES A DISPLAY OF MAYPOLE DANCING AND OTHER TRADITIONAL COUNTRY DANCES.
BANKS ALSO KEEP UP A TRADITION OF A MORRIS DANCING TROUPE WHO PERFORM AT SOCIAL EVENTS AND TAKE PART IN COMPET ITIONS.
